title: Second division football leagues in Europe ranked by revenue 2011/12
summary: This bar chart has 5 columns on the x axis representing Football League, and Income (in million euros) in each Football League on the y axis.
Football League Championship (England) has the highest Income (in million euros) and Segunda Division (Spain) has the lowest Income (in million euros).
The difference of Income (in million euros) between the highest and lowest Football League is 389.2.
min_summary: This is a bar chart representing Football League in the x axis and Income (in million euros) in the y axis.
Football League Championship (England) has the highest Income (in million euros) and Segunda Division (Spain) has the lowest Income (in million euros).
mid_summary: This bar chart has 5 columns on the x axis representing Football League, and Income (in million euros) in each Football League on the y axis.
Football League Championship (England) has the highest Income (in million euros) and Segunda Division (Spain) has the lowest Income (in million euros).

max_summary: This bar chart has 5 columns on the x axis representing Football League, and Income (in million euros) in each Football League on the y axis.
The Income (in million euros) is highest at Football League Championship (England) and lowest at Football League Segunda Division (Spain).
Second maximum Income (in million euros) is found at Football League 2. Bundesliga (Germany).
The difference of Income (in million euros) between the highest and lowest Football League is 389.2.

The Football League Championship (England) has the highest Income (in million euros), followed by 2. Bundesliga (Germany), and Serie B (Italy). Down to the Football League Segunda Division (Spain) which is the lowest.
The lowest value 201.1 at Segunda Division (Spain) is almost 1.8 times smaller than the average value 328.46.
Summing up the values of all Football Leagues, we get total 1642.3.
